front.title: WhoDP: Widely Hosted Object Data Protocol

abstract.t: The Widely Hosted Object Data Protocol (WhoDP) exists to communicate the current location and state of large numbers of dynamic, relocatable objects. Initially and most commonly, these objects are people, and the groupings or spaces that people use to enable communication. Loosely patterned after HTTP, WhoDP implements a publish-and- subscribe model, with objects' location and identity specified via URLs. A WhoDP program ''subscribes'' to locate and receive information about an object; a WhoDP program ''publishes'' to control the location and visible state of an object.
